chapter.title: Preflight
chapter.para: The first step in certifying that the platform is installed and configured properly is to run a preflight check on the components. This ensures that all machines are operating and have the proper executables running. This also confirms there is adequate disk space, available memory, and acceptable available CPU % values.

A screen similar to the following displays.
Expand the folder for the System Server then check the box next to the desired component(s).
With the servers selected, the preflight action button activates and you can press it to display the preflight options.
Check or uncheck any desired options then Press the Submit button to start preflight.

sect2.title: EXPECTED RESULTS:
sect2.para: After pressing Submit, a screen similar to the following displays.

System Component Information
This screen displays information about the selected system components. This information indicates whether the components are actually running appropriately. The resulting page shows useful information about each component. The component name, location, condition, the component state, how long the component has been up and running, the amount of disk usage, memory usage and other information is available at a glance.
If there are any alerts, the component(s) are highlighted, indicating they require further attention.
For example, the following image indicates there is an issue with the DFU Server.

sect1.title: Preflight Target Clusters
sect1.para: Use the Target Clusters link to preflight all your clusters.

listitem.para: Click on the Operations icon then click on the Target Clusters link.
This displays a detailed listing of all your systems' Clusters.
Click on the select all check box, in the top row on the left side, to select all of the target clusters.

Optionally, you can just check the box(es) next to only the cluster(s) you want to preflight. If you choose to preflight all Target Clusters, you do not need to preflight Thor and Roxie separately as detailed below.
With the clusters selected, the preflight action button activates and you can press it to display the preflight options.
Select or de-select any desired options, then press the Submit button at the bottom to start preflight.
NOTE: Depending on the size of your system, there could be a slight delay in displaying the results.

sect2.title: EXPECTED RESULTS:
sect2.para:
After pressing Submit, a screen similar to the following should display. Target Cluster Information
This screen displays information on your system's component nodes. This information can help to indicate if everything is operating normally or can help to point out any potential concerns.
If there are any notable alerts, they are highlighted. These alerts usually require some attention.
If you have any alerts you should examine the specified component further. It is indicative of some kind of problem or abnormality.

listitem.para: Click on the Operations icon then click on the Cluster Processes link.
Expand the Thor cluster by clicking on the arrow next to the ThorCluster link.
Check the box next to any individual nodes to examine or check the Select All checkbox in the first row.
With the systems selected, the preflight action button activates and you can press it to display the preflight options.
Select or de-select any desired options, then press the Submit button at the bottom to start preflight. Submit
